```{r calculate-v-given-d-t, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
sf <- 3 # significant figures to use
d <- signif(runif(1, 10, 99), 3) # distance in m
t <- signif(runif(1, 100, 199), 3) # time in s

ans <- d/t
dis <- c(t/d, d*t)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = 0.005, range = c(0, d*t), format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sapply(sc$questions, signif, sf)
sc$questions <- sprintf("\\SI{%g}{m/s}", sc$questions)
```

Question
========
Suppose an object travels \SI{`r d`}{m} in \SI{`r t`}{s}. What is its average speed?

```{r questionlist, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use the formula for constant velocity motion.

$$ v = \frac{d}{t} = \frac{\SI{`r d`}{m}}{\SI{`r t`}{s}} = \SI{`r signif(d/t, 3)`}{m/s}$$
